Docs.summary: Acquire the latest Image from the ImageReader's queue, dropping older Image images.
Docs.returns: latest frame of image data, or null if no image data is available.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if too many images are currently acquired

Docs.value: Maximum number of images for this ImageReader.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.Media.ImageReader NewInstance (int width, int height, Android.Graphics.ImageFormatType format, int maxImages);
.method public static hidebysig class Android.Media.ImageReader NewInstance(int32 width, int32 height, valuetype Android.Graphics.ImageFormatType format, int32 maxImages) cil managed
Public Shared Function NewInstance (width As Integer, height As Integer, format As ImageFormatType, maxImages As Integer) As ImageReader
public: static Android::Media::ImageReader ^ NewInstance(int width, int height, Android::Graphics::ImageFormatType format, int maxImages);
static member NewInstance : int * int * Android.Graphics.ImageFormatType * int -> Android.Media.ImageReader

Docs.param: The default width in pixels of the Images that this reader will produce.
The default height in pixels of the Images that this reader will produce.

The format of the Image that this reader will produce. This must be one of the android.graphics.ImageFormat or android.graphics.PixelFormat constants. Note that not all formats are supported, like ImageFormat.NV21.

The maximum number of images the user will want to access simultaneously. This should be as small as possible to limit memory use. Once maxImages Images are obtained by the user, one of them has to be released before a new Image will become available for access through #acquireLatestImage() or #acquireNextImage(). Must be greater than 0.
Docs.summary: Create a new reader for images of the desired size and format.

format.a: Java documentation for android.media.ImageReader.newInstance(int, int, int, int).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.Media.ImageReader NewInstance (int width, int height, Android.Graphics.ImageFormatType format, int maxImages, long usage);
.method public static hidebysig class Android.Media.ImageReader NewInstance(int32 width, int32 height, valuetype Android.Graphics.ImageFormatType format, int32 maxImages, int64 usage) cil managed
Public Shared Function NewInstance (width As Integer, height As Integer, format As ImageFormatType, maxImages As Integer, usage As Long) As ImageReader
public: static Android::Media::ImageReader ^ NewInstance(int width, int height, Android::Graphics::ImageFormatType format, int maxImages, long usage);
static member NewInstance : int * int * Android.Graphics.ImageFormatType * int * int64 -> Android.Media.ImageReader

Docs.param: The default width in pixels of the Images that this reader will produce.
The default height in pixels of the Images that this reader will produce.

The format of the Image that this reader will produce. This must be one of the android.graphics.ImageFormat or android.graphics.PixelFormat constants. Note that not all formats are supported, like ImageFormat.NV21.

The maximum number of images the user will want to access simultaneously. This should be as small as possible to limit memory use. Once maxImages Images are obtained by the user, one of them has to be released before a new Image will become available for access through #acquireLatestImage() or #acquireNextImage(). Must be greater than 0.

The intended usage of the images produced by this ImageReader. See the usages on HardwareBuffer for a list of valid usage bits. See also HardwareBuffer#isSupported(int, int, int, int, long) for checking if a combination is supported. If it's not supported this will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
Docs.summary: Create a new reader for images of the desired size, format and consumer usage flag.

format.a: Java documentation for android.media.ImageReader.newInstance(int, int, int, int, long).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Public Overridable Sub SetOnImageAvailableListener (listener As ImageReader.IOnImageAvailableListener, handler As Handler)
public: virtual void SetOnImageAvailableListener(Android::Media::ImageReader::IOnImageAvailableListener ^ listener, Android::OS::Handler ^ handler);

abstract member SetOnImageAvailableListener : Android.Media.ImageReader.IOnImageAvailableListener * Android.OS.Handler -> unit override this.SetOnImageAvailableListener : Android.Media.ImageReader.IOnImageAvailableListener * Android.OS.Handler -> unit

Docs.param: The listener that will be run.
The handler on which the listener should be invoked, or null if the listener should be invoked on the calling thread's looper.
Docs.summary: Register a listener to be invoked when a new image becomes available from the ImageReader.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: If no handler specified and the calling thread has no looper.
